shell out (something).translation[0].def: to pay a lot of money for something, especially unwillingly
If you want the repairs done right, you’ll have to shell out at least $800.
She ended up shelling out for two rooms.
shell out (something).translation[1].def: to spend a lot of money on something, often when you do not really want to
The insurance company refused to shell out for repairs.
NFC shelled out £75 million on 16 businesses.
